title: Drawing, "Precinct of a palace"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Shown is the central part from the left corner of the front. Partly drawn over an account and writing exercises of Sono (?). More writing and an account is above the right part of the drawing. In the center above, teh beginning of a rough sketch fo the central part of the facade.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Precinct of a palace".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1101.
